definitions.definition: to praise someone in order to make them feel attractive or important, sometimes in a way that is not sincere:
examples: I knew he was only flattering me because he wanted to borrow some money.

definitions.definition: to believe something good about yourself although it might not be true:
examples: [ + that ] Steve flatters himself that he's an excellent speaker.

definitions.definition: to give the appearance of being better than the true situation:
examples: I suspect these statistics flatter to deceive.

definitions.definition: to feel very pleased and proud because someone has said good things about you or has made you feel important:
examples: She was flattered by his attention.

definitions.definition: to make someone look more attractive than usual:
examples: That new hairstyle really flatters her.
